docs.abstract: Editorial relates experience of Rashid Perkins with New York City's Fresh Air Fund, which sponsors trips out of city for inner-city youth; encourages support of low-cost program that can have immensely positive long-term impact on worldviews of those like Perkins.

docs.snippet: Buck Uptmor was a short, feisty man who spent nearly all his 45 years riding, racing and tending to horses, and died trying to rescue horses near the West fertilizer plant....
docs.lead_paragraph: Buck Uptmor was a short, feisty man who spent nearly all his 45 years riding, racing and tending to horses, and died trying to rescue horses near the West fertilizer plant.
docs.abstract: Family and friends attend funeral of Buck Uptmor, one of 14 victims of deadly explosion at fertilizer plant in West, Tex, who died trying to save his horses.

headline.seo: In West, Tex., Blast, Wrangler Died Trying to Save Horses
headline.main: In Texas Blast, Horseman Died Trying to Save Creatures He Loved

byline.contributor: Alain Delaquérière contributed research from New York.

docs.snippet: For more than three days, the very ordinariness of their activities let the Tsarnaev brothers hide in plain sight....
docs.lead_paragraph: For more than three days, the very ordinariness of their activities let the Tsarnaev brothers hide in plain sight.
docs.abstract: Tamerlan and Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, brothers accused of carrying out Boston Marathon bombing, picked up their daily routines directly after attack; ordinariness of their activities allowed the brothers to hide in plain sight.

headline.main: After Attack, Suspects Returned to Routines, Raising No Suspicions
headline.print_headline: After Attack, Suspects Returned to Routines, Raising No Suspicions
